Meta.ShortDescription: The excessive breakdown and formation of bone, followed by disorganized bone remodeling. This causes affected bone to weaken, resulting in pain, misshapen bones, fractures, and arthritis in the joints near the affected bones.

Symptoms.Symptom: Many people have a mild case with no symptoms
Symptoms can be confused with arthritis and other disorders
The first manifestation is usually elevated alkaline phosphatase in the blood
Loss of hearing in one or both ears
Compression of the nerves that supply the eye, leading to vision loss

Causes.Cause: Slow virus infection (i.e. paramyxoviridae) present for many years before symptoms appear.
Associated virii include respiratory synctial virus and canine distemper virus
Laboratory contamination may have played a role in past studies linking measles to Pagets
Two genes, SQSTM1 and RANK, and specific regions of chromosomes 5 and 6 are associated

Diagnostics.Diagnostic: Elevated alkaline phosphatase in the blood
Markers of bone turnover (pyridinoline) in urine

Treatments.Treatment: Biophosphanates: Risedronic, alendronic, pamidronic, and Etidronic acids

Prognoses.Prognosis: Although there is no cure for Paget's disease, medications (bisphosphonates and calcitonin) can help control the disorder and lessen pain and other symptoms.
